alert.note: Alert for Christian; Dade; Greene; Lawrence; Webster (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 23 at 9:20PM CDT until September 24 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Christian, Dade, Greene, Lawrence and Webster. * WHEN...Until 330 AM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 920 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Wilson`s Creek at Farm Road 150, Sac River at County Road 1247, Clear Creek at Farm Road 87, Turnback Creek at County Road 2100, Wilson Creek at Farm Road 156 and Wilson Creek at Farm Road 146. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Springfield, Republic, Battlefield, Strafford, Willard, Rogersville, Ash Grove, Brookline, Glidewell, Ebenezer, Galloway, Bois D`arc, Cave Springs, Turners and Bassville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
